title: Forget ‘Like’ button! Love, Haha, Yay, Wow to take over Facebook (Watch video)
text:
Forget ‘Like’ button! Love, Haha, Yay, Wow to take over Facebook (Watch video) By Priya Prakashan on October 9, 2015 at 11:57 AM Comments 
Mark Zuckerberg took to his official Facebook page to share a live testing video of the brand new emoticons launched on Facebook. The bunch of emoticons called the Reactions are a more expressive Like button. So from now on you can be more expressive rather than just hitting the Like button while using Facebook to express yourself. 
A lot of people express their themselves by hitting Like on various posts on Facebook. Now with these additional reactions you can help express better on Facebook. To give a more positive approach to the Facebook experience, they have steered clear of the ‘Dislike’ button that people were looking forward to. But the new reactions will have the feelings of Sad and Angry to share empathy and sorrow. 
The Facebook CEO said, “At a recent Townhall Q&A, I shared with our community that we’ve spent a lot of time thinking about the best way to give you better options for expressing yourself, while keeping the experience simple and respectful. Today we’re starting to test this. We hope you like this or can better express how you’re feeling!” You can c lick here to view the live video of the same on the official Facebook account of Mark Zuckerberg. 
Through the Reactions you can express love, awe, humor and sadness by the emoticons of Like, Love, Haha, Yay, Wow, Sad and Angry. These reactions have been added to help you express better in your virtual world. The format has been kept minimal and simple, so as to make it easy for you to express online. 
The first test will be done in Ireland and Spain before it becomes live and available to the rest of the world. Till then you can use the Like button to express your fondness about anything and everything you find online.
